clinical_study.brief_title: The Safety and Efficacy Evaluation of Hair Products Containing Probiotics
clinical_study.official_title: Testing of Hair Products Containing Probiotics

collaborator.agency: Chia Nan University of Pharmacy and Science

brief_summary.textblock: Previous studies on skin health with Lactic acid bacteria (LAB) have been published for many years, including prevention of skin diseases and improvement of skin conditions. In this clinical study, the investigators researched the benefit effects of heat-killed Lactobacillus paracasei shampoo on scalp and hair healthcare.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of hair products containing probiotics

primary_outcome.description: The changes of scalp microbiota will be evaluated by NGS or qPCR analysis at baseline and different timepoint post-intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 weeks, 4 weeks, 6 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks, 20 weeks and 28 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The scalp sebum will be measured by Sebumeter SM815 (C+K, Germany) at baseline and different timepoint post-intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 weeks, 4 weeks, 6 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks, 20 weeks and 28 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The scalp flakes will be evaluated by D-SQAME ® DANDRUFF TESTER at baseline and different timepoint post-intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks, 20 weeks and 28 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The hair number in a constant scalp area will be measured by Aramo TSII skin/hair diagnosis (Aramhuvis Co., Ltd. Korea) at baseline and different timepoint post-intervention.
Any adverse event, such as erythema,rash, itching and so on will be recorded during the intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Single application closed patch epicutaneous test under occlusion
secondary_outcome.description: Probiotics on skin will be evaluated by Human Patch test. The Human Patch test method according to the Guidelines of Human Patch test Standards for Cosmetics, Taiwan Food and Drug Administration, 2019 edition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Repeated application closed patch epicutaneous test under occlusion
secondary_outcome.description: The irritation potential of probiotics on skin will be evaluated by Human Patch test. The Human Patch test method according to the Guidelines of Human Patch test Standards for Cosmetics, Taiwan Food and Drug Administration, 2019 edition.

arm_group.description: Shampoo base without probiotics inculding Aqua、Sodium Lauryl Ether Sulphate、Cocamidopropyl Betaine、Cocoamide DEA、Sodium、Polyquaternium-10 、Disodium EDTA、Acrylates Copolymer、Citric Acid、Phenoxyethanol、Fragrance.

Shampoo base with probiotics inculding Aqua、Sodium Lauryl Ether Sulphate、Cocamidopropyl Betaine、Cocoamide DEA、Sodium、Polyquaternium-10 、Disodium EDTA、Acrylates Copolymer、Citric Acid、Phenoxyethanol、Fragrance、Heat-killed Lactobacillus paracasei powders (5x10^8 cells/ g-shampoo).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers between the ages of 20-70.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects are undergoing medical therapy for scalp, hair diseases or diabetes mellitus.
- Subjects with cosmetics allergy.
- Subjects had accepted the scalp surgery such as Follicular Unit Transpalnt, Follicular Unit Extraction in the past half year.
- Subjects with pregnancy or breast-feeding.
